abstracts.cdata!:
The Andhra Pradesh Economic Reform
            Loan/Credit Project (APERL) supports the State of Andhra
            Pradesh's fiscal and governance reform program. The
            fiscal reform program aims for fiscal stabilization to
            reduce the debt burden and restore sustainability to public
            finances, improve public resource mobilization, and
            restructure public spending toward priority development
            areas. This is accompanied by public expenditure management
            reform to strengthen financial management capacity and
            institutions, improve the realism and credibility of the
            budget, enhance fiscal transparency and accountability, and
            introduce greater efficiency to operational management. The
            program of governance reform includes strengthening
            anti-corruption efforts, civil service reform, electronic
            governance, public enterprise reform, and a program of
            poverty monitoring and analysis. There are fourteen specific
            triggers or prerequisite actions that had to be completed
            for the APERL, which, as detailed in this report, have been
            completed. The expected beenfits proceeding from this
            project are: 1) strengthening the government's fiscal
            and financial health; 2) a more conducive investment climate
            for private sector growth; 30 more efficient and effective
            public service delivery; and 4) improved social outcomes and
            reduced poverty. The loan/credit will be disbursed in one tranche.
